name: Sweet Celebrations with the Moda Bake Shop Chefs (SIGNED BOOK)
description: Packed with over 40 holiday-themed designs including my Festival of Lights pattern, this book is full of precut-friendly projects sure to make your next sewing adventure lots of fun!

name: Windspinner: PDF Quilting Pattern #121
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Grab your favorite 2½” precut and get sewing on this super fun, sassy, scrappy quilt! It goes together quick and easy, no fuss, and the results are stellar. Windspinner is a quilt you’ll want to make over, and over, and over. Three sizes: Crib, Twin, and Queen.

description: Grab your favorite 2½” precut and get sewing on this super fun, sassy, scrappy quilt! It goes together quick and easy, no fuss, and the results are stellar. Windspinner is a quilt you’ll want to make over, and over, and over. Three sizes: Crib, Twin, and Queen.

name: Multiplication: PDF Quilting Pattern #120
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

If a quick, easy, and adorable baby quilt is just your style, Multiplication just became your new best friend. Darling to look at and super easy to piece, this will be your new go-to pattern for every new baby in the neighborhood. A great starter project for a beginning quilter.

description: If a quick, easy, and adorable baby quilt is just your style, Multiplication just became your new best friend. Darling to look at and super easy to piece, this will be your new go-to pattern for every new baby in the neighborhood. A great starter project for a beginning quilter.

name: Leaflet: PDF Quilt Pattern #119
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

In just a few hours you can make this beautiful quilt by using a whole cloth background and some speedy machine applique. Leaflet is the perfect chance for you to master machine applique, all while showing off your favorite prints.

name: Leaflet: Quilting Pattern #119
description: In just a few hours you can make this beautiful quilt by using a whole cloth background and some speedy machine applique. Leaflet is the perfect chance for you to master machine applique, all while showing off your favorite prints. Template included.

name: Rubix Too: PDF Quilting Pattern #118
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

With blocks sized perfectly to fit a 5” precut square, Rubix Too is a great variation on my original best-selling Russian Rubix pattern. Larger scale pieces, a stunning layout, and multiple size options (queen, twin, and throw) make this a pattern you’ll want to try out in lots of different fabrics and sizes.

name: Rubix Too: Quilting Pattern #118
description: With blocks sized perfectly to fit a 5” precut square, Rubix Too is a great variation on my original best-selling Russian Rubix pattern. Larger scale pieces, a stunning layout, and multiple size options (queen, twin, and throw) make this a pattern you’ll want to try out in lots of different fabrics and sizes.

name: Sweetie Pie: PDF Quilting Pattern #117
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Ranging from X-Marks-The Spot to classic Art Deco patterns, the possibilities are endless with this versatile pattern. Shown here in darling children’s fabrics, Sweetie Pie could also be made with sophisticated prints for an entirely different look. Using a single piece of fabric for the background, the design is made entirely using one of three applique methods.

Multiple layouts to choose from!

Materials:
9 Fat Quarters
1 1/8 yards white solid
2/3 yard border fabric
3 1/8 yards backing (if using 42" wide)
OR 1 5/8 yards (if using 60" wide)
55" x 55" batting
3/8 yards binding

44" x 44" finished size

name: Parcheesi: PDF Quilting Pattern #116
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Inspired by classic games and classic gardens, Parcheesi is a scrappy blend of practical and pretty. Large enough to serve as a bed coverlet or a throw-for-two, you’ll love the look of this stunning quilt and lovely detailed blocks.

Materials:

16 fat quarters
3 yards white fabric
3/4 yard red inner border fabric
1-5/8 yard floral outer border fabric
8 yards backing fabric
2/3 yard binding fabric
94” x 94” batting
86” x 86” finished size

name: Parcheesi: Quilting Pattern #116
description:
Inspired by classic games and classic gardens, Parcheesi is a scrappy blend of practical and pretty. Large enough to serve as a bed coverlet or a throw-for-two, you’ll love the look of this stunning quilt and lovely detailed blocks.

3 yards white fabric
3/4 yard red inner border fabric
1-5/8 yard floral outer border fabric
8 yards backing fabric
2/3 yard binding fabric
94” x 94” batting

86” x 86” finished size

name: Two for the Show: PDF Quilting Pattern #115
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Sometimes you just need a quick gift for a sweet little one, and sometimes it’s nice to have a stash of gifts on hand! Two for the show gives you just that, two easy-as-pie quilts from one set of 10” squares. So now, you’ll have one quilt to take to that baby shower tomorrow, and one to keep for the next one. Brilliant!

Make 2 baby quilts from the same 10" squares!

Shared Materials:
42 10" squares

Additional Materials for Quilt A:
1/4 yard white solid
7/8 yard border fabric 
3½ yards backing (if using 42" wide) 
OR 1¾ yards (if using 60" wide)
60" x 61" batting
1/2 yards binding
49" x 49"

Additional Materials for Quilt B:
3/4 yards white solid
5/8 yard border fabric 
3  yards backing (if using 42" wide) 
OR 1½ yards (if using 60" wide)
53" x 59" batting
3/8 yards binding
45" x 51"

name: Summer Crush: PDF Quilting Pattern #114
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Summer Crush is as sweet and classic as a summer romance. Intoxicating results, but sometimes a little bit tricky to get just right. A beautiful throw quilt in any fabric combination, this quilt requires working with triangles and bias edges. Just as with love, proceed gently and with patience. 

60" x 68"

Materials Needed:

(42) 10" squares
1 ¾ yards background fabric
¾  yard border fabric
4 yards backing
½ yard binding
68" x 76" batting

name: Big City: PDF Quilting Pattern #113
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Big City is a quick and easy pattern to get a bed-sized quilt without a lot of fuss. Perfect for your first attempt at making something bed-sized, or a quick fix for a bed that needs a pick-me-up. The oversized pieces make it perfect for showing off large scale prints.

96" x 96" King/Large Queen
Materials Needed:
7½ yards white solid
5 yards assorted fabrics in ¼ yard increments
8 2/3 yards backing (42" wide)
104" x 104" batting
¾ yards binding

66" x 84" Twin
Materials Needed:
5 yards white solid
2½ yards assorted fabrics in ¼ yard increments
5¼ yards backing
74" x 92" batting
5/8 yards binding

Cover Fabric is Grand Hotel by Jenean Morrison for Free Spirit Fabrics

Paper Patterns will be delivered by USPS, PDF Patterns will be delivered by email download.

description:

96" x 96" King/Large Queen

66" x 84" Twin

name: Savvy Satchel: PDF Sewing Pattern #112
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

I had the perfect bag, once upon a time. It was the perfect size to fit my sketchbooks, pencils, a water bottle, and a few books to keep the kiddos entertained. Then it wore out. A new art satchel was needed, this time with a little more flair. I kept the dimensions the same but added some stripes--because really, everything is better with stripes.

The Long and Short of It:
10" x 3½" x 12"

(18) 2½” x width of fabric strips
1 1/3 yards heavy fuseable interfacing
½ yard lining fabric
16” x 35” batting
magnet closure

Cover fabric: Origin by Basic Grey for Moda

name: Russian Rubix: PDF Quilting Pattern #111
description:
My little brother, lover of puzzles, games, and new ideas showed me the design, made out of tiles from a board game.
"This would make a pretty sweet quilt, dude. Probably it's too hard though, right?"
I took it as a challenge. Hard? No. Breathtaking? Oh yes.
This one's for you, Bruce.

The Long and Short of It:
Multiple Size Options (crib, throw, twin, queen)

A great way to use up those fat quarters you've got sitting around.

Cover fabric: Just Dandy by Josephine Kimberling for Robert Kaufman fabrics.

name: Home for Harvest: Quilting Pattern #110
description:
When I first imagined this quilt, it was on a college student's single bed, far from home. A simple, but beautiful heirloom that reminded them of home, family, and the love that binds across distance.

The Long and Short of It:
Multiple size options (throw, twin, full/queen, king)
See pictures for back cover, which includes fabric requirements.

Optional heart applique.

name: Simply Seasonal: PDF Quilting Pattern #109
description:
Looking for a quick and simple way to make your table festive? I've got you covered. Simply Seasonal is a table topper pattern that is quick and easy to make, and better yet, takes only a 5" square precut and a yard of fabric. Make one for every season!

Table Topper:
23" x 23"

(40) 5” squares of various fabrics
3/4 yard backing
1/4 yard binding
27”x 27” batting
Fuseable web (optional)

Includes applique shapes for all four seasons.

Cover fabric: Awesome by Sandy Gervais for Moda

description:

name: Coming Up Clovers: PDF Quilting Pattern #108
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

A large throw quilt pattern that would be a great way to try your hand at applique for the first time. If you've done applique before, this will go together and quick and easy for you. Either way, this one turns out beautiful, and is just the right size for a picnic.

Large Throw:
70" x 70"

(42) 10” squares
1/3 yard white solid (inner border)
1 yard aqua print (outer border)
4-3/8 yard backing
1/2 yard binding
78”x 78” batting
1-3/4 yard light fuseable webbing

Cover fabric: Lovely by Sandy Gervais for Moda

name: Petite Playtime: PDF Quilting Pattern #107
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

A sweet little quilt that would be a perfect project to welcome that new arrival. Petite playtime can be made with precut 5" squares, and a bit of yardage, for a snuggly little number that is sure to whip up speedy-like.

Crib Size:
40" x 40"

(64) 5” squares of various coordinating materials
(5/8) yard cream solid
(1 3/8) yard 60” wide chenille backing
3/8 yard binding
48”x 48” batting
Fuseable web (optional)

Cover fabric: Breakfast at Tiffany’s by Joanna Figueroa for Moda.

name: Scrap Basket {Remix}: PDF Quilting Pattern #106
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

I haven't met a set of colors or fabrics that doesn't look great in a giant basketweave. Try it with your favorite stash fabrics, you'll see what I mean. A great pattern for a beginning quilter that wants to make a large quilt. With big pieces, this quilt goes together in a hurry!

Materials:      
• (20) 1/4 yard Width of Fabric (not Fat Quarters) cuts, 
   in various coordinating colors
• 7/8 yard white solid (background & inner border)
• 1½ yards blue print (outer border)
• ½ yard brown print (binding)
• 5½ yards backing fabric
 
76 x 98“ batting

Finished Quilt: 68x90” (twin)

Cover fabric: 
Fabric is Hooty Hoot Kangaroo by Doohickey Designs for Riley Blake.

name: He Zigs She Zags: PDF Quilt Pattern #105
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

As a mama of twins, I needed something that was versatile, coordinating, but not too matchy matchy. He Zigs She Zags was born of that need. Twin size, with 2 applique shapes to choose from, this quilt may just solve your shared room dilemma like it did mine. A great pattern for practicing angle cutting. No Y seams. Includes both flower and star applique shapes.

Materials:      
(1) Precut 2½” roll of strips (40 strips) 
OR (14) 1/4 yard WIDTH OF FABRIC cuts
3/8 yard green floral (flowers/stars)
3-1/4 yards white solid
5/8 yard polka dot (middles, binding)
OR ½ yard for binding only if using star applique
6 yards backing
74 x 98“ batting

Optional: 1/2 yard fuseable web

Finished Quilt: 66x90” (twin)

Cover fabric: 
Meadowsweet by Sandi Henderson
for Michael Miller Fabrics.

name: Prep School Knockout: PDF Quilt Pattern #104
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

A fun and versatile twist on a classic argyle, this quilt uses ribbon for the stripes, instead of piecing. There are so many possibilities: Camouflage fabric with twill tape stripes, satins and velvets with sequin stripes, or some good old fashioned flannels with grosgrain. Any way you mix it, this one’s a knockout!

Materials:      
5--1/3-yard pieces assorted colored prints OR 20 precut 10 inch squares
1-3/4 yard white solid (background)
7/8 yard border white print (border)
5/8 yard multicolor stripe (binding)
4 yards backing fabric 
66 x 80 batting
24 yards ribbon or trim

Optional:
Walking foot strongly suggested.

Finished Quilt: 60x73”

Cover fabric: 
Life’s a Hoot by Tammy Andersen for Adorn It Just Sew

name: Little Lanterns: Quilting Pattern #103
description:
Perfect for staying warm and cozy on a fall evening, Little Lanterns is an innovative pattern that uses simple blocks to create a beautiful quilt that looks much more complex than it really is. Reminds me of little paper lanterns on the porch at our "Hooray It's Fall!" party. No Y seams.

Materials:      
(40) 2½" strips (two of each print) 
OR (20) 1/6 yard cuts
1/2 yard dark brown print (sashing)
3/8 yard cream solid (border)
1-1/8 yard cream print (border)
3½ yards backing
60x74“ batting

Finished Quilt: 60x74” (throw)

Cover fabric: 
Cotton Blossoms by Bonnie and Camille for Moda.

name: Grammy's Scrap Basket: PDF Quilting Pattern #102
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

With so many beautiful fabrics out there, I love that this pattern can show off so many at one time! Grammy’s Scrap Basket is easier than it looks, and works up in a hurry. A perfect quilt for a sweet new baby, featuring an optional first and middle or last name. Applique templates for both boy and girl shapes are included (football helmet, star, butterfly, flower).

Materials:      
• 1-3/4 yards various scrap material
  (width of fabric) In increments as
  small as 1½” OR 1½” precut (40 strips)
• 5/8 yard white solid (sashing)
• 1/2 yard pink floral (border)
• 1/2 yard green print (binding)
• 1-5/8 yards backing
• 44x56“ batting

Finished Quilt: 41x53” (crib)

Cover fabric: 
Simple Abundance by Bonnie and Camille for Moda.

name: Dancing in the Wind: PDF Quilting Pattern #101
description:
PDF PATTERN: This pattern will be sent to you digitally, via email download.

Inspired by pinwheels blowing on a warm summer day, Dancing in the Wind is the perfect scrappy quilt for cloud watching, daydreaming, or enjoying a cool breeze under the trees. A great pattern to practice your half-square triangles and flying geese.

Materials:      
(1) Precut 2½” roll of strips (35+ strips) 
OR (12) coordinating Fat Quarters
5-3/4 yard white solid (background)
½ yard brown print (sashing pinwheels)
½ yard brown print (binding)
2/3 yard yellow print (setting triangles)
1/3 yard multicolor print (middle border)
5 1/4 yards backing fabric
 
72 x 96“ batting

Finished Quilt: 64x88” (twin)

Cover fabric: 
Spirit by Lila Tueller for Moda.
